content:
Phishing Risk Analysis

Our analysis of the URL https://jepctlwkt-xn--ffwacq7i-xn----c1a1cj-xn----p1ai.translate.goog/Sgxm3n99/rsgxR/mXTGO?YTNWaWFYTjBZVUJ0ZFhBdVkzbz06Y2pSd1E+&_x_tr_sch=http&_x_tr_sl=koxBtZzE&_x_tr_tl=tuLZnjOT has revealed an extremely high risk of phishing. The URL received a risk score of 100, indicating a very high probability that it is a fraudulent website designed to steal your information.

Key Risk Indicators

  • Suspiciously Long and Complex URL: The URL is excessively long (178 characters) and contains a confusing mix of letters, numbers, and symbols. This is a common tactic used by phishers to obfuscate the true destination of the link and make it harder to recognize as malicious.
  • Unusual Domain Name: The domain name (jepctlwkt-xn--ffwacq7i-xn----c1a1cj-xn----p1ai.translate.goog) is highly unusual, containing multiple hyphens and encoded characters. Legitimate websites typically use clear and concise domain names.
  • Abuse of a Legitimate Service (Google Translate): The URL incorporates "translate.goog," attempting to mimic a legitimate Google Translate link. Phishers often exploit trusted services to make their links appear less suspicious.
  • Long and Encoded Parameters: The parameters after the question mark (?YTNWaWFY...) are long, encoded, and nonsensical. This is another red flag, suggesting an attempt to hide malicious code or redirect users to a dangerous site.
  • High Number of Hyphens and Underlines: The excessive use of hyphens (13) and underlines (9) within the URL is another indicator of a potentially malicious link. Legitimate URLs rarely employ such a high frequency of these characters.

Technical Assessment

The URL's structure raises several serious concerns. The domain name itself is unusually long (61 characters) and complex, incorporating numerous hyphens. While the presence of "translate.goog" might initially lend an air of legitimacy, the surrounding characters and overall structure betray its malicious intent. The long, encoded parameters further contribute to the suspicion. Although the analysis indicates the presence of a TLS/SSL certificate (indicated by "https"), this alone does *not* guarantee safety. Phishing sites can also obtain SSL certificates. The DNS records related to MX servers (mail exchange) and name servers are missing, which is unusual for legitimate domains. The URL also has a short Time-To-Live (TTL) for its hostname (300 seconds), which can be an indicator of dynamically generated domains often used in phishing campaigns.

What This Means For You

If you were to click on this link, you risk being taken to a fake website designed to steal your personal information. This could include your login credentials, credit card details, social security number, and other sensitive data. The attackers could then use this information for identity theft, financial fraud, or other malicious purposes.

Recommended Actions

  • Do Not Click the Link: Under no circumstances should you click on this URL.
  • Report the Suspicious Link: Report the phishing attempt to PhishGuard and, if applicable, to the service the link is impersonating (in this case, Google).
  • Be Wary of Similar Links: Be cautious of any links that look similar to this one, especially those that are unusually long, complex, or contain unfamiliar characters.
  • Double-Check the URL Before Clicking: Always carefully examine the URL of any website before entering your login credentials or other sensitive information. Look for clear, concise domain names and be wary of anything suspicious.
